alert.note: Alert for Butte; Meade; Pennington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 11:03AM MST until December 21 at 11:45AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Butte County in northwestern South Dakota... Meade County in west central South Dakota... Eastern Pennington County in west central South Dakota... * Until 1145 AM MST. * At 1102 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Fairpoint to near Box Elder, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 44 and 103, as well as Highway 44 from Rapid City to Scenic. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Rapid City, Rapid Valley, Ellsworth Air Force Base, Box Elder, Summerset, Black Hawk, New Underwood, Union Center, Piedmont, Wasta, Scenic, Plainview, Enning, Owanka, Elm Springs, Stoneville, Caputa, Fairpoint, Wicksville and Red Owl. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
